intro: Hedeoma gilliesii, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery-gray leaves and daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. It is often found in the lower North Island and parts of the South Island. Hedeoma gilliesii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
